{"step_by_step_thinking": "Omaveloxolone is a synthetic oleanane triterpenoid. It is known to activate Nrf2, a transcription factor that regulates the expression of antioxidant proteins that protect against oxidative damage triggered by injury and inflammation. NFkB, on the other hand, is a protein complex that controls transcription of DNA, cytokine production and cell survival. There is no scientific evidence that suggests omaveloxolone activates NFkB.", "answer_choice": "B. no"}
